Text: As of now there's no seeders but you better be up to the task up loader! Thanks btw!
Most movies aren't 1080. But as far as I know it only means that you have black in the upper and lower part of the screen. Still good quality.

The bluray might encode black for the top and bottom, but if it's 1920 wide than it's a "1080p" standard movie.  If that's the case, the mkv rip just gets rid of the pixel data for the bars, as it's a waste of space.  Many blurays are in 2.35 aspect and will not fill a 16:9 hdtv.
